abstract: An hour-long results episode of “So You Think You Can Dance” garnered 8.2 million viewers on Thursday, enough to elevate Fox into first place for the night’s ratings, according to Nielsen’s estimates. Although the 9 p.m. reality show lagged behind CBS’s “CSI” rerun in its time slot (8.7 million), Fox’s “Are You Smarter Than a Fifth Grader?” compensated by leading the 8 p.m. hour (7.4 million) just ahead of CBS’s new show “Greatest American Dog” (7 million).
lead_paragraph: An hour-long results episode of “So You Think You Can Dance” garnered 8.2 million viewers on Thursday, enough to elevate Fox into first place for the night’s ratings, according to Nielsen’s estimates. Although the 9 p.m. reality show lagged behind CBS’s “CSI” rerun in its time slot (8.7 million), Fox’s “Are You Smarter Than a Fifth Grader?” compensated by leading the 8 p.m. hour (7.4 million) just ahead of CBS’s new show “Greatest American Dog” (7 million).

headline.main: Ratings: America Has Spoken — Fifth Graders Are Just Slightly Better Than Dogs
